page.title: 09CLITHEROE MARKET
page.content: Clitheroe Market takes place every Saturday and Tuesday. The roads become very busy on those days especially on Saturdays. Most kinds of goods are sold, fruit, vegetables, toys, sweets, flowers and clothing. The stalls are mainly brick with wooden 'flaps' that fold away. The goods are loaded early in the morning, then the buyers come and it is then that it starts to become busy. The stalls are built in rows with room for about a car in between. On non market days the market place is deserted, with only a few cars parked here and there. Now it is only used as a short cut by motorists. After a busy Saturday or Tuesday the stalls shutters are closed for another two or three days.
